misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct formula and correct Java execution model)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes reading three doubles from input, computing (v1 - v0) / t, and printing the result will produce the average acceleration.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no gap: Java evaluates input in the order of nextDouble() calls, performs floating-point subtraction and division as expected, stores the result in a double, and prints it via string concatenation. This matches the given physics formula a = (v1 - v0) / t and the sample run output.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; output matches expected behavior (for nonzero t).
